result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando Antwone Cain Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Orlando Antwone Cain Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Tom Reed in court for Orlando Cain Jr.  Attorney Amanda Kirklewski in court on behalf of Attorney James Griffin for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for an Order to Show Cause Hearing.  Court finds good cause to allow the Public Defender's Office more time to find an attorney to appoint.  However, Court will consider appointing counsel at county expense at the next court date.  State Public Defender's Office notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Orlando Antwone Cain Jr appeared by video.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing with Defendant's other case 22CF4276. Discussion placed on the record. SPD has not appointed counsel. Statements made by Defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for State V. Lee hearing. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. Court may appoint Attorney at County expense if Public Defender's Office does not appoint Attorney at the next hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 2.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Orlando Antwone Cain Jr not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's appearance is waived for todays hearing. SPD has not yet appointed counsel. Court adjourns matter in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
8/23/2022 final pretrial entry made in error. Next court date is 09/12/2022 at 1:30 pm for status of counsel, Branch 2
Letter from defendant re:  Bail Reduction.  (Orlando A. Cain, Jr., Milwaukee County Jail - Pod 3B Cell 3, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Cobe Deshaun Newble in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Cobe Deshaun Newble.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution, defense requests plea and sentencing date. Motion to withdraw is withdrawn. Case adjourned, Branch 2.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Orlando Antwone Cain in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Orlando Antwone Cain in custody.  Amanda Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears via Zoom.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing. Court vacates final pretrial and jury trial dates.  status of counsel scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Orlando A. Cain, Jr. - #2022004057, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (20 pages) commencing 04-14-2022, by KATHLEEN S. WORDEN.
signed, Order to Allow Zoom Access to Discovery
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Orlando Antwone Cain in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Orlando Antwone Cain in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel appears via Zoom. Case scheduled for pea hearing. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Requested Bail Modification.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Orlando Antwone Cain not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense request to transfer case from Branch 4 to Branch 2 for global resolution. Court grants request. Defense requests a projected guilty plea date. Case adjourned, Branch 02.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defense is requesting that case is heard in Branch 02. Court grants request, case is set for bail hearing on 05/24/2022 at 1:30 PM in Branch 02.
Defense Requested Bail Modification, filed.

Defendant Orlando Antwone Cain in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Orlando Antwone Cain in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Domine.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with co-def:  Cobe Newble
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Orlando Antwone Cain in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Orlando Antwone Cain in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Orlando Antwone Cain appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
